This place is seriously good. Sort of like voodoo donut in Portland, they have some very different and interesting flavored donuts. My fav is definitely there coffee mocha donut and their bacon maple donut. The others we tried were good as well but those two really stuck out to me.

Extremely disappointed in the service here . After driving for 30 minutes to get to this doughnut shop our friend convinced us to get up and go to we were left with a selection of 3 different types of doughnuts . We told them it was our first time and how far we had driven to come in . All we were told was oh well it's national doughnut day you should have come earlier . No coupon to get us to come back and I'm assuming the older man who opened the door for us was the owner and unlike one of the reviews where he gave them a free doughnut to try no offer or even attempt was made to make our trip worth it . 

The reason I'm giving it 2 stars was because of the actual donut, it was decent . The service was terrible . I definitely won't be driving out of my way to go there again .
Always a great variety and obviously freshly baked.  Friendly and helpful staff.

Oh my flavorful doughnut muses have been busy! 8am there was a line, but they move fast & it was totally worth it. Great flavors, beautiful, real creams, no cheap flavors or filling here! Pink sprinkle, glazed, key lime pie, maple bacon, caramel, the Elvis chocolate bannana, Nutty Pig, oh my... just go! :-)

DO IT! 24/7 DONUTS! You would think this would be a very bad idea, I mean it is if you are on a diet or diabetic or something. But if you are a fat kid and it's midnight or 4am, or whenever, Pinkbox gots you. I've been a few times at random hours. I think the best times I've gone have been in the morning like 6am or so when you just can't sleep and keep thinking about delicious donuts. I usually get a dozen and split them with somebody. One donut a day is the best way to start the day, not sure who said it but i think it's true. My favorites are the crunch bar, pink velvet, lemon, birthday cake, and blueberry. They have a lot of different options for everyone's different tastes. I know my boyfriend really likes the fat Elvis, but I'm not a hug fan of banana. They also have maple bacon and regular donuts. They have sprinkles and fillings and just all the sugars. I like to grab a bottle of chocolate milk and eat my first one on the way home. It tastes so good on the way. I really wish there was one closer to my house but hey I'll drive across town for some good donuts. :)

Wow! Really good donuts at reasonable prices! We stopped here with a dire need of donuts and were very pleasantly surprised. We got a dozen and I tried the birthday cake, maple bacon, and caramel cheesecake! 

They were all fantastic! Not overly sweet and very fresh!

My only issue was the way these beautiful donuts were just kind of crammed into a box. I guess it doesn't affect the taste but c'mon....why waste all that time decorating when you're just gonna smash a maple bacon bar on top of the key lime pie??

I am definitely coming back every time I'm in town! :)

Oh yeah!!!! (Pause for dramatic effect)

I'm going to make this short because there are enough reviews about how awesome this place is. In fact I had seen about 3 police cars pull up as I was walking out, you know it's good !!!

Fat Elvis is pretty much the greatest donut ever made. In fact any of these donuts are top notch!!!! I'm not gonna lie, the best donuts in Nevada, actually prob the west coast United States!!

Now opened 24/7.... You can't go wrong with a fresh pink box (donut)

Ok one bad thing is your waist will be destroyed by this place, but at least you'll be fat and happy

I've heard about Pinkbox for quite a while and they seem to have exploded here in town, so I'm surprised at myself that it took me as long as it did to give them a shot.

They are located in a generic strip mall along with tons of other chain shops. The store is small. There were a few of us in line and we all had to keep maneuvering to let one another by since it was so cramped. 

Their fridge was down, so they were keeping all cold beverages in the back. They have quite a few options as far as donuts so but nothing really stood out to me surprisingly. I decided on the green tea because it looked the most enticing and the tutti frutti because I thought it was the most photogenic. 

The girl behind the counter was really nice and I was on my way out the door with my selections in no time. 

The green tea was my favorite. Fresh, soft and subtle in flavor. I enjoyed this donut the best of the two I chose. The tutti frutti did nothing for me. It was overly sweet and the frutti pebbles on top had hardened. The cake donut was well-made and I ended up scraping the icing off and enjoying that part.

Overall, everything I tried was decent but I don't see this becoming my go-to donut spot.

Too cute... not enough substance. Making a good donut isn't too difficult but these guys want to turn up the science and creativity level all of which is completely unnecessary. The dozen I bought for my overweight office has had a hard time finding any takers. This could be because the donuts are overcooked and to the sight are not appealing. Once they are in your mouth much doesn't change either. They are crispy when they should be fluffy. When it comes to donuts I like to keep it simple... chocolate bars, devils food, rainbow sprinkles... nothing too crazy. I tried the sweet potato donut but wasn't impressed. Tune down the fancy, don't overcook and keep it simple! 

I may try it again, but I'd rather eat at Winchell's or the donut shop on Durango & N I-215 any day of the week instead of Pinkbox.
I don't eat donuts but when I do it's the Pink Box! You have to try the maple bars with bacon! BOMB!

These are hands down the best donuts. Friendly, patient staff that really like working with the public. The names are originally humorous. Fat Elvis so far is my favorite - all the flavors together melt in your mouth -no wonder he loved peanut butter and bananas. With the apple fritters you taste the cinnamon and apples-not fried sugar. The cereal-topped donuts will transport you back to childhood. Fruit loops, coco pebbles and Capn Crunch top rich and delicious chocolate or original glazed donuts.  Double yumm!!! This place is a hit not a miss. Even the house blend coffee is worth the trip.

I'm hooked. Now I want to share with friends. Enjoy!!!

I can't believe I hadn't written a review for Pink Box yet... my diet nemesis...

I have a favorite little donut shop in my hometown, and well frankly, Pink Box blows it out of the water! I'm sure all the other review talk about how wonderful their specialty donuts are so i don't need to go into all those details. I'll just say my two favorites are their Cronuts (you have to ask, they don't always have them and they're not usually on display) and their Bacon maple Bar. I have dreams about them both!

The location is small, just large enough for a display case and a few patrons, but the decor is cute and the staff is simply wonderful! The owner is often on site, there's often a greeter at the  front door, and on occasion they've been known to throw in an extra donut for good measure. Yesterday's visit I unexpectedly got a free Cronut - not that I need the extra calories but it made my day!!

On one visit there I was babysitting a puppy who'd just gone through surgery and lost one of it's legs. I couldn't leave her in the car so I brought her in, holding her in my arms - something I would never do under normal circumstances. The staff didn't mind at all, they welcomed her, petted her and treated me as well or better than every other visit.

These donuts are the bomb, but you should give them your business simply because they are good people. Don't hesitate.. just go!! Just be warned, you need to buy more than one donut or you'll wish you had.

A ton of my friends were posting pictures of their doughnuts from Pink Box and that same day, my boyfriend had tried one at work.  Everyone seems to love this place, especially on Yelp, so we drove to their Lake Mead location two Saturdays ago.  When we arrived, there were a lot of people in line, but not a lot of variety when it came to doughnuts (none of the cereal doughnuts, no cronuts, etc.).  

We ordered a gourmet dozen featuring:
 Fat Elvis:  Our favorite.  The peanut butter, chocolate, and banana flavors all really go well together.  It's heavy, rich, and overly-sweet.

Chocolate-Bacon Bar:  We really didn't care for the chocolate-bacon one; the bacon was too smoky (it seemed like artificial smoke flavor and the bacon bits were really hard). 

Banana Creme Pie:  The flavor of this donut was divine, but the messiness was a real nuisance.  Both of our donuts squirted (not oozed, but squirted) all over the place and it was not fun trying to clean it off of our shirts, the carpet, etc.

Cheesecake:  I personally really liked this doughnut.  It's rich and creamy; I especially like the chocolate icing on top of the doughnut.

S'mores:  I always love anything S'mores flavored, but this doughnut was a disappointment.  It really didn't taste anything like a S'more and we'll never get it again.  The filling reminded me of the sickly-sweet white cream inside of the krispy creme doughnuts, which tastes nothing like marshmallows (in my opinion).

Apple Pie:   I hated this one, but I hate apple pie.  The apples were crunchy, ew.

I don't mean to be hard to please, but I think I'll have to visit again to see if their other options are better.  I think people just go crazy over this place because of the "novelty" of it, but it's really nothing special from what we could tell.
Not impressed!. I purchased the glazed specialty at approx. 9:15am and it was stale. I'll stick to the bagels shop next door. I did however love the customer service and the guy at the door ;}....

Always fresh and fun. This is a must stop when you're in Vegas. Locals love it and tourists should not miss this lil spot full of donut delights. Their selection can't be beat and never a dull flavor. They have all the usuals and some fun flavor you don't expect but glad you tried. Decent prices and great customer service make this a 5 star all the way!!!

I thought I would start the year out right...with a yummy freshly baked batch of donuts.
Since it was New Year's Day I assumed they were closed so I called first to make sure they were open. "We'll see you in a few!"  he said after letting me know they were open.

Just a small line when I got there and lots of choices that you might not find at other donut shops.  The Cro-nut was first on the order!  The S'more donut was next, the fruity pebbles topped donut was added, blueberry, chocolate glazed, red velvet and more chocolate. I'm trying the Elvis donut next time (banana and peanut butter).

I have to say the flavors were outrageously creative and the flavors were on the mark. Really a yummy box of donuts that honestly I would offer as dessert at a dinner party!

Great place to come and get a quick donut fix!

Highlights!
Yummy Donuts
Friendly Service
Outrageous and clever recipes

Lowlights!
$2.25 for a cro-nut (yikes!)
$12 for a dozen donuts if you include some gourmet ones in the box.

Ok, I have now been here a few times and have definitely had a change of heart.  I still think their plain cake doughnut is a bit too plain, but I have discovered the following:

- Fat Elvis: Like The King, it is fat, rockin', & makes you swivel your hips.
- Nutty Pig: There are way too many things going on with this doughnut, but, when you get that bite that has all the crazy ingredients (Bavarian cream, maple icing, date, bacon, almond, bleu cheese, balsamic reduction) you see life through different eyes.
- Baple Macon: A doughnut bar with bacon crumbles & a buttery maple glaze.  Best warm.
- Cronuts: Buttery/greasy goodness of a deep fried glazed croissant.  I think it took a year off my life but was well worth the sacrifice.

Please, you owe yourself to come in in the morning & sample these deep fried nuggets of pure goodness.

This place is by far, one of the best donut shops I've been to. Their donuts are so delicious. My husband and I fell in love with the "Fat Elvis" which is a donut stuffed with peanut butter and banana filling with chocolate cream and a slice of banana on top, and their "Maple Bacon Bar" is to die for too...it tastes like pancakes and bacon. 
My family and I are from Los Angeles, but we're here at least twice a month because my in-laws moved down here. I can't believe tonight was our first time finding out about this place. 
Although this location is quite a drive from the strip, it's definitely worth the drive, and the best part is that it's open 24hrs!!! The employees are so friendly, they even made 2 donuts that they ran out of, just for my 5yr old niece because they saw how sad she was when we told her they were out of what she was asking for.
I totally recommend this place and will be telling all our friends and family about it...we're actually even bringing a dozen of their specialty donuts back to L.A. with us so we can let our friends and family have a taste.

Absolutely love this place. They are 24 hours a day always making fresh doughnuts and the workers are amazing. Love them too they all should get a raise for what they deal with. Some customers that go in there can be stupid as all hell but that's not their fault. 

The Owner or manager whoever, she is some (don't quote me) Colombian women was yelling hard core at her staff one day and that's not acceptable. Treat your employees with respect.

Every Sunday I come here at different times. Sometimes 8:30am, 9:30 am, 10:00am and they never have cronuts. If every Sunday they run out, they should know they need to make more. This is my last Sunday going back :(
Great service and awesome donuts with some interesting flavors.

I happen to see this spot on the
Food network and said to myself
One day I will travel across the earth
(Henderson to Summerlin) To have some 

Lucky for me someone
Made the drive for me (Girlfriend).
They all lived up to the hype 
My favorites are the fat Elvis 
And the Cronuts must tries 
 
So if grandma wants a dozen glazed
Store bought doughnuts skip this place
This a foodie doughnut experience

Delicious (but pricey) donuts. Some awesome flavors going on, and they switch it up which is nice. Not for those people on a diet, haha.

I really enjoy the Smore's one.

Open 24 Hours :)
If you love a good donut then definitely recommend Pink Box donuts.  They are the best in town!
This place is Great...  I went today for the first time. If u like donuts,  u have to try this place..

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(195/365) "Still Not Happening"

So over a year later, I finally gave in and gave Pinkbox another try. The only good thing is that they are open late, so if you're a huge fan, good for you. I noticed that they revamped the display case and only display one of each doughnut available at the moment while everything else sits on racks to make it easier to fill peoples orders.

we decided to go with a Maple Bacon Bar, Nutella Doughnut, Bubble Gum Doughnut, and a Banana Cream Pie Doughnut. Took two bites of the Banana Cream Pie, and a tiny bite of each of the rest. The texture of the doughnut seems to have improved a bit, 
but for me, the toppings seemed too overly sweet and/or very artificial, so we fed the garbage can the rest.

I still prefer the OG stand alone shops that have been around a lot longer (Ronald's. Real, and Friendly's) Pink Box seems to be doing well with more locations popping up around town, but for me, it's all about simplicity and quality, not quantity...ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter;  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  2.5

I've been anxiously waiting for Pink Box to open since it's close to my office.  Sure enough, they opened while I was out of the country and I made coming here my top priority as soon as I got back.

They're open at 6am and today I got a cup of Pink Box Blend coffee, Fat Elvis, Chocolate-filled, Raspberry-filled and Campfire Smores doughnuts.  I liked them all and I love how they have the classic flavors and also unique ones.  My favorite is the Campfire Smores doughnut - it has blow-torched marshmallows, chocolate and graham cracker crumbs on top.  I was worried that it'll be too sweet but it wasn't.  The Fat Elvis has chocolate, caramelized banana on top and peanut butter inside.

You can get a dozen doughnuts for $8.50 and a cup of coffee for $1.50!

I wish they would come up with other flavors too like green tea doughnuts!  I'm all for supporting local businesses and I'm hoping they would reach Top Pot Doughnuts is to Seattle, Pink Box is to Las Vegas status.  Just add a few more flavors and coffee options.
My favorite place when I'm craving sweets...would try every doughnut if I could..lol always nice friendly staff and the owner is very friendly as well.

Ahh! Doughnuts!! 

I love this place tons! So much to choose from and its 24 hours! The workers are super friendly and the doughnuts itself are amazing! 

Raspberry Filled
Maple Bar 
Chocolate Coco Pebbles 
Chipotle Caramel
The Fat Elvis 
Captain Crunch Bar
Fruity Pebbles


LOOOOOVE IT. Will be coming back soon!
One of my favorite spots to get donuts in Las Vegas. One of my favorites is the Red Velvet... would like one right now...
Yum!  Try their cro-nuts or the sweet potato donuts.  Making me hungry thinking about them.

How to surprise your family on a Saturday morning? A big Pink Box! A dozen of Pink Box!

Is it a PB&J, Caramel Cheesecake, S'Mores, Buttermilk Bar iced with chocolate, pink iced vanilla cake with sprinkles, chocolate dipped vanilla cake with rainbow sprinkles, Apple Fritter, Red Velvet, Old Fashioned, and more cake doughnuts with sprinkles? Yes! Yes, to all.

The service at 8:45 AM this morning was quick and cheerful. With three people working at the counter, a fourth person arrived to help serve the growing customer line. First there were four patrons in line, then me and more people entered the tight venue. Smiles glazed across our own faces, everyone was in a good mood. I appreciated the kindness from a  generous man who offered to help me with my own order.  Is there something potent about the aroma of doughnuts that adds more than just sweetness in the air?

If you LIKE the Pink Pix Facebook page, you can follow their news like Pokemon iced doughnuts, National Doughnut Day and their generous financial contribution to the Salvation Army in 2016, and fun alternatives like Strawberry Shortcake doughnuts and waffle pressed doughnuts. 

Since Pink Box has become so successful with gourmet fare and sweets and a "I  Doughnuts" love to the community, can you add an ORGANIC selection treats to your menu?  Bring our Las Vegas, our southern Nevada ORGANIC doughnuts and some gluten-free variations, please.

So glad there is not one of these on any route close to home because I would be hospitalized for overdosing on donuts!
So fr""&$&&$$6kin good! Ordered a gourmet dozen for friends and family, not gonna divulge how many I ACTUALLY ate, but nonetheless it was a good price for the mixture of gourmet and classic donuts.
We got  the maple bacon, SMORES!!! Classic maple, cheesecake, strawberry and cream, lemon pie, cookies and cream, apple, and some other ones. Anyways we came after dinner, and they are open 24/7 to all you hoggies like me! They were fresh and melted in your mouth! The cream one was fully loaded and sweet:) 

You have to try this place before Guy Fieri comes in and puts it on TV and they sell out! 

#ivealwayswantedmyveryownpinkbox

It's a cute doughnut shop that's open 24 hours. How can you beat that? Reasonably priced, they have the classic and gourmet donuts. My personal faves are Cookies and Cream and Smores. The interior is pretty basic but the staff is friendly. I will definitely come back.

Just ordered my second order through Eat24 ..I woke up craving doughnuts from PinkBox Doughnuts . I love that they are 24 hours 7 days a week . Through Eat24 I ordered two half dozen boxes . You get 2 original 2 specialty and 2 gourmet doughnuts . My only complaint is a lot of the specialty or gourmet doughnuts I wanted to try were not included in my order. I don't know if that's because they sell out on certain flavors earlier in the day or they or just trying to hold onto them. I feel if I'm paying $20.00 plus $4 for delivery I should be able to try the flavors I want . I keep getting more of the chocolate assortment . My favorite so far is the caramel cheesecake, The Fat Elvis, Cookies & Cream, and S'mores ... I want to try the Key Lime & The MapleBacon bar . I even heard the Snickers Bar was delicious. I guess I have to go to the actual location in Summerlin and keep my fingers crossed on being able to try the other flavors . I'm just happy there's a doughnut place close that offers more than your usual Dunkin Doughnuts . If you haven't tried PinkBox Doughnuts give it a try you will be hooked after your first experience . They are a little pricey but it's worth it .

I don't normally eat donuts, but I will drive all the way across town for this place on occasion. They have an AMAZING celection of gourmet donuts that you won't find anywhere else. Last time I was in I tried their Cronut and it was Awesome!!! My other favorite is the Maple Bar covered in Real Bacon bits. The salt & sweet taste go so good together. Drive past the Dunkin Donuts and come try some real tasty ones instead!!
Also can't forget to mention the staff. The owner is often there to open the door for you, everyone welcomes you with a smile and recommendations.

my boyfriend introduced me to this place. mind you I am a donut lover at heart. like I have donut pajamas haha anyway he told me they have the best in the city and this unique one called the Elvis. I was already intrigued. we got there and the lady said they were out but she can make them. I was like wow that's great customer service already! it took about 20 min so we came back and got a dozen of assorted donuts including the Elvis. let's just say the donuts barely made it home. immediately inhaled them haha thanks pink box! :)
I love the donuts here, but I wish they were warm. There's a lot of cool choices like bacon and nuts, banana cream, and Cronuts!

It was pretty delicious. Got the mocha and it was the best I ever had! You can actually taste coffee! Unlike other places where you get a hint of it. And the strawberry short cake is a must!! Strawberries were fresh, the whip cream was nice and thick..was just delish. This place is a must. Only downfall is the kiddos got the donuts with cereal toppings and the cereal were pretty stale and didn't taste very good. Also sister and I got a dozen. Don't get it unless you plan on eating it all the same day. If not they're not as good and get stale pretty fast. Oh and the cronut! Sister got it and it was super light and crunchy! Was soooo good. Wish I would've gotten it!

the gf has been on a shit food tear.  She calls in the morning on Friday and asks me to buy donuts for her and the office mates.  Oh that's right, i'm the retired boyfriend that sits by the phone at her beckoned call.  Okay, missy what do you and the other employed want.  Basically a dozen ( pics posted ) 

The highlights -

Bavarian crème - rich crème filling and excellent chocolate frosting

Fat Elvis - I didn't try but the office staff loved them

Bacon Maple Bar - I've had similar donuts in Portland, LA and NY - Vegas wins, HANDS DOWN ! 

Average - 

The blueberry, the chocolate with chocolate cereal topping

Below average:

Apple fritter

prices ranged from $1- $1.75 each.  a little on the high side but I appreciate the creativity.

I'll be back !

Yes, I am a fan, but with the high sugar content of these wild and crazy donuts sold here, I can only be a fan a few times a year or my dentist will punish me. This location is in a cramped shopping area so parking can be a bit tight. The store is super TINY and narrow! I can't imagine how people browse the selections when its busy. Strangely, the display case is really low so much that I had to bend down to see the names of the donuts. So I decided to do squats each time I admired the donuts to help burn off some calories before I wolfed down my treats. I try to eat healthy and limit the amount of sugar so this is definitely a "treat" to partake in every once in awhile. I can't even remember the names of the donuts that I bought, but they were beautifully made. The two donuts that I ate were flaky, sweet, flavorful, and fresh. I like that the donuts have unique ingredients, mixtures, and toppings- Pink Box is very creative. The two employees were friendly and helpful with our questions. The prices are a bit high, but again, these are not plain ordinary donuts- these are masterpieces of the donut world.

Pink Box has been on my book mark list ever since it opened almost a year ago and since I started working close to this side of town I FINALLY got my chance to try them. $8.50 for a dozen is pretty reasonable in my book because Krispy Kreme costs like $13. I ordered a dozen plus a gourmet one which was the pumpkin cake. The pumpkin cake was good, but unfortunately didn't knock my socks off. I should of tried the pumpkin cheesecake, but the employee recommended the pumpkin cake because of the chocolate shavings on top. I also tried the blueberry, it was just "okay." It would of been better of the blueberry flavor was a little bit stronger. Although I was not wow'd by the 2 donuts I tried, I will still give them a few more chances until I find a donut that does. On the other hand, my co-workers enjoyed the donuts, specifically: What A Joy and Lemon Pie were the favorites, I guess next time I'll have to see for myself. 

I'm giving them 4 stars because there is no other donut shop in town that has such creativity as they do and the ambiance/interior is super cute, even if it is all pink. Make sure to call ahead if you are going there for a specific donut because I know they only have a certain selection each day and cronuts will be available after 9:30. Can't wait to come back and try Pink Box!
Had a middle of the night craving 2am for delicious  doughnuts.. Pink Box it is.. Love that they are open 24/7. My 2 dozen were fresh and delicious. I can never go wrong here...

This place was recommended by a friend since he said they were open 24h a day and they always had fresh donuts. We ordered a variety of donuts but I have to say I only tried about 3/12 because we took them to a party/potluck. The place is quiet small and there is no where to sit and enjoy your donuts if u wanted to eat it there unless you wanted to sit outside in the Las Vegas 100 degree weather in the summer. 
The donut selection wasnt very good. And I hate to say it but we got a couple of the dulche de leche ones because my husband loves that flavor and it was such a huge disappointment! It taste like a regular glazed donut with chocolate filling on top (and a bad regular glazed donut as a matter of fact.) 
I always judge a donut shop by its regular glazed donut because all that other crap is all just toppings and fillings to hide the real test: the dough and cooking. 
I hate to say it but I had the regular donut twist and that was cold and not soft and kinda chewy. 
The only other one I tried before people took some of the other ones was the blueberry one. That one was pretty good. Cake like donut with lots of blueberries in it but it tasted artificial to me. 
From what I heard from people at the party is that they werent impressed either. And the one someone said they def didnt like was the one with the colorful "what looked like fruity pebbles" on it as the fruity pebbles were soggy and tasteless- his words not mine.
Im not sure if ill come back here and Im sorry I couldnt give this a better review :(

So good. Open 24 hours and far from my house but so worth it. I dislike cloyingly sweet and heavy desserts so my favorite here are the plain glazed yeast donuts. I had a mountain of powdered sugar avalanche when I dusted one donut off.

Went here a few days ago and they had a very limited selection if donuts available---basically every donut I saw on yelp was not available when I went it may have to call ahead to make sure they have the donuts you want... The customer service was okay very young and semi unprofessional talking with their visiting friends etc. but the donuts that I did purchase were good! Wish I could've tried the more unique donuts.

Loved these donuts!  I got 2 dozens, one for my coworkers and one for some contractors...everybody loved them!  My co-workers were doing the good 'ol let's cut the donut into quarters so that I only eat a small piece, but everyone kept back coming for more!  Donuts were GONE in less than an hour! My favorite is not too extravagant: Captain Crunch, it's amazing.  Not too light not too heavy...it's perfect!

Very friendly staff, a bit crowded with only eight people (I would think they'll expand soon), a good variety of donuts as other people have said, and the price wasn't that bad, my order totaled about $8.50

My Order:
2 Maple Bacon Bar - I definitely enjoyed this but I think it would be better with a little chocolate on top. It was very light and fluffy which made it easy to eat it very fast.
2 Cinnamon Tornado - WOW these things are enormous, light, sweet and do not have too cinnamon in them.
Sweet Potato - I asked the young lady who waited on me her favorite and this is what she suggested, I'm glad I listened to her, it was different but definitely worth trying and I would get it again. 
Original Glazed - I think anyone could devour at least three of these and not realize it because like I said, all their donuts are so light and don't weigh you down. 

This company is doing great and I can't wait to see how they expand and come up with more ideas. Still reminds me of VooDoo Donuts lol.

I was craving for doughnuts. Since I live near here, I might as well try here. They had many selections of doughnuts from classic to specialty donuts. 

The doughnuts here are VERY DELICIOUS and always made FRESH. I am a big fan of the Bear Claw doughnut and they make it very GOOD!

This shop may be small but they have small showcase of doughnuts where you can see it. If you want the doughnut, they get it from another case where there are many quantities of doughnuts behind them. Not a bad idea for a GOOD DOUGHNUT SHOP.

I RECOMMEND you to come here. They actually OPEN 24 HOURS which means you can have doughnuts anytime you want!

Not great for my "eating clean" program but if I must be bad these doughnuts are awesome!

One of my hockey buddies turned me on to them. We were leaving the rink after a very late game one night and he said he was driving there to pick up doughnuts.  I told him they were probably closed but I knew a 24 hour place.  He said not only are they open 24/7 but his wife "wanted them for a business meeting first thing the next morning and will not eat doughnuts from anywhere else."  I now know why.

This review is only for their cronut/crodough donut. It was OK. I wasn't happy that it was super cold. I did not know how long it was out. Also, the flavor wasn't there. It really didn't have layers that I could peel (which is the best part), it was quite soggy. I didn't even finish it.

The customer service was okay. I thought they went through the customers very quickly on a busy Halloween morning. I like that they are open 24 hours.

I might come back. I'm not sure. Donut Mania still
makes the better cronut.

Pink Box in Las Vegas is a small donut bakery, yet offers custom gourmet donuts similar to Portland, Oregon's Voodoo Donuts. The bakery it self is small but the concept is awesome. They come a little pricey than most donut places but this isn't your regular donut shop. Upon entering the store...a glass display shelf that showcases the various custom flavors. I haven't had a chance to try them all, but the banana cream pie and Elvis are customer favorites. If you don't have a sweet tooth, they do have plain donuts and pastry as well. 

They are open 24 hours so anytime you have that sweet craving ... You know where to go!

As a connoisseur of gourmet baked goods I placed much scrutiny over the half dozen of assorted beauties I purchased from Pink Box today.  The staff were very friendly and accommodating, the branding simply charming, the product delectable!  Not overly sweet, cake-like yet crispy, lavish fillings - perfect!   I would drive for miles for these divine delicacies.  Unfortunate for my waistline, Pink Box is located just down the road.....

I saw this ace on yelp and decided to give it a try based on reviews and the fact that it's open 24 hours. I called before going in just to make sure they had a variety to choose from. The guy (Tony. I think) was very friendly and assured me that they did.

When I arrived I noticed the place is indeed tiny. Not a place I would want to come when it's busy. Being that it was almost 2am I wasn't expecting fresh donuts. To my surprise I was actually able to snag a few that were just made. I kept it simple and got 6 donuts. I don't like chocolate not am a fan of cream filled donuts so I didn't try any of those. My daughter chose the strawberry shortcake one ( one if the fresh ones) and is in love. I got a glazed , blueberry and apple fritter for myself. The other two were tutti fruity and a chocolate bar. 

I love the blueberry donut! I somehow made one disappear before I got to my car. I sent my daughter to go buy one more and she came out with two fresh ones! After trying these donuts we have all agreed this will be our only donut place!

The staff is super friendly and very helpful. I'd come back just for the great customer service if I didn't enjoy their donuts.
Clean, friendly, efficient. The gentleman in the pink vest and hat is adorable and sweet. The donuts are affordable and delicious. 10/10 would come back again.

Two of the best donuts I've ever had, and I've had many. The Fat Elvis and the Campfire S'Mores lived up to their reputation. What made the Campfire S'Mores so special was the house-made toasted marshmallow. Also can't go wrong with the peanut butter filled Fat Elvis. The donuts had perfect chew while being light and not greasy.

Good lord this place is to die for. I'm admittedly addicted to donuts but I tend to get pretty jaded about everyone and their brother trying to open a donut shop. Pink Box seriously knocks it out of the park though. Their cake donuts are the lightest and fluffiest I've ever tasted. They make their own icing and it's amazing. They seem to get a little out of control with the crazy flavors...putting cereal and what not on donuts, but if no one judges my donut habit, I won't judge theirs. 

The staff is also friendly and courteous. I had a day when I went in and they didn't have the donuts I wanted. The girl at the counter just let me know to call ahead when it's convenient and she would set one aside for me. I'm only lucky I'm not 400 lbs because of this place.

Let me preface this first by saying that I don't normally do sweets or desserts in general. BUT THIS PLACE IS MAKING A LIAR OUT OF ME!

Three words: MAPLE. BACON. BAR.

Of course they have others but every time I go here, its all about the above mentioned. Service is spectacular especially if you call in advance to put in an order and they are open 24 hours on the weekend! 

This maybe my shortest review ever but I cant make it anymore simpler than this!

Incredible place!  Traditional doughnuts with a non-traditional twist!  I love the creative combinations and most definitely see Pink Box Doughnuts going taste-bud viral!  While Los Angeles may have Sprinkles Cupcakes to brag, Las Vegas has Pink Box Doughnuts ready to go global!

I admit it... I've changed from absolutely disliking donuts to becoming a regular at this place... sigh.

These donuts are delicious, especially the cronuts (which are $1 extra from the regular donut price). My sister and I are addicted to this open 24 hour shop. 

This donut shop is very small with just a window displaying all the donuts they have available at the moment. They always have a good variety of specialty and classic donuts but one thing they don't have in stock all the time are the cronuts! Hence the 4 stars haha. The cashier ladies are always nice and patient with me despite my indecisiveness. Theres just so many flavors to choose from.

I've read reviews saying that at times there is not one donut left in the place but for the many times I have been here they always seemed to be well stocked =]
I love this there creative donuts , family own business and customer service is the best Gold star for Pink Donuts

BEST doughnuts in town and they one 24hr location conveniently located near my gym.  haha.  

without a doubt the best and would HIGHLY recommend them to anyone.
Very friendly and charismatic owner. Donuts were awesome. Good atmosphere seems to be good people. Will definitely be back before I leave town.

Amazing donuts!  I don't know why it took me so long to go here!  The fat elvis and nutty pig are my favorite!! My friend loves the maple bacon bars.  The staff are friendly and helpful the donuts are fresh and tastey.  They are like little pieces of delicious cakes in your mouth.  There are so many savory choices to choose from.  I suggest getting a half dozen for a great price and a good sample. Go now and get the pink box experience! Yum!
Can we talk about the MAPLE BACON BARS?!?!?! Delish! 4 stars because they run out of product all the time! Worth a go for sure.. not your standard doughnut shop.

The most delicious donuts and croissant/donuts ever!  Great job folks at Pink Box!
I bring them to my boss on occasion and she rushes them off to the break room as soon as they come thru the door!

The name and the signage of this place gave me high hopes, but these doughnuts are awful.  I'm all for fresher ingredients that a standard doughnut place, but these have almost no flavor.  The jelly filling is not in the least bit sweet.  It's actually a little tart.  The "raised" versions are not raised at all, but are very cake like.  I haven't tried the "cake" version, because the "raised are already far too dense.  The flavors are much too mild. I've ordered the glazed twice. One had no glaze at all, but was plain, and the next had barely a drizzle.  The sweet potato is ordinary, the jelly is flavorless, the buttermilk style is so-so but almost too dense.  I've had 3 visits in hope to find something good, but have found nothing at all.  Had high hopes, but no luck.  Oh, also, the overcharge. After mentioning problems with a couple of doughnuts they offered to give me a replacement.  On both visits, I realized when I left they charged me for what the offered for free.  My fault for not catching that the second time.

We came here just 3 days after it opened its doors. My first impression was definitely the warm welcome we immediately received upon entering and then the aroma hits you like a sweet sugary kiss.  It smells of old fashion doughnuts, all kinds too. On the day we came in they mainly had cake style doughnuts and we tried a little of everything, from an Elvis to a doughnut filled with bacon and dates and while waiting for our order lance had us try their sweet potato doughnut...mmm delish. Their display is filled with a unique take on flavors you would not necessarily identify doughnuts with which makes this place very impressive. Also try their awesome coffee imported from Arizona.

Love how they're open 24/7! Hate that they were out of the maple bacon bar =( but I also did go in at 12AM so that's most likely the reason why they were out lol. But there's nothin like yummy donuts to fulfill late night sweet cravings! Definitely coming back because there's so much more I want to try!

I was having a sugar craving. This is not far from work. A coworker and I went over at lunch. 
The store itself is small but clean. We were greeted right away. The young lady at the counter was very helpful and nice. 
So many choices, they all looked good, except maybe the fruit loop one. We picked up a dozen for work. 
The maple bacon was my choice and I was not disappointed. It was fantastic. Sweet and savory, with the right amount of bacon. The doughnut itself was a tasty piece of heaven. 
One of the best Doughnuts I have ever had. 
Our coworkers loved all of them. They were gone in minutes.
Always delightful staff and amazing donuts!  Fresh and reasonably priced for amazing quality.

It's open 24/7!  They have donuts with cereals!  I was like "who wants to eat a donuts with cereal like fruit  loops!"  My kid said "I want that one!" 
Never underestimate anything. 
I gave it a 3 stars bc it's very sweet the toppings.  It's over glazed and it's falling apart when I ate the donut.

Tasty light fluffy dough with some unique flavors.

Abbreviated to bullet points...

*Maple bacon, Lemon coconut, or glazed Cronuts!
*Cap'n crunch w/crunchberries bar!
*Smores donut!
*Caramel cheesecake donut!
*Fat elvis donut!
*Open 24 hours so I can get any one of these and more any time I want!

Go!
Very good. Liked the fat Elvis and the sweet potato

Pink Box went above and beyond for my son on his 6th Birthday today. I walked in and asked if they could please design my son a Pokemon donut since this whole Pokemon craze my son is obsessed. The lady there did an amazing job! My son is going to be so stoked! And she made me one extra too.

It's been said before but it's worth repeating, the BEST donuts in town.  I will only eat Pink Box donuts from now on.  Why waste your empty calories on second best when you can have PINK BOX, haha!  Ok, seriously, their donuts are always super fresh, probably bc they sell so quickly.  Every flavor is well made.  Raspberry filled is my personal favorite but you really can't go wrong with any of them, Boston creme, Date with a Pig (interesting and not in a bad way), chocolate glazed, S'mores, etc.  all good.  Just writing about them is making me hungry for them.

Pretty darn good donuts with an excellent array of interesting and original choices. If you go later in the day, there are less options to choose from, but you get a great deal on a dozen of whatever is left!
Donuts are always delicious and fresh. The baple macon bar is our favorite.  Havent got me a jalapeno sriracha donut. Maybe they will respond and let me know what days those are made! Lol

After reading an article that this was voted the best donut in Nevada- patronizing this place was a must. Let me tell you...that article couldn't have been anymore spot on! This place is not only the best in Nevada , but pretty darn close to
One of the best donuts I've ever eaten. 

Love that the donuts are served in none other than....you guessed it....a PINK BOX! Yes, I know on the west coast seeing a pink box is pretty normal but this NYer got a kick out of it. 

Any who- the donut....simply delicious ! The actual dough is soft , light , moist & amazing. The filling and creations that PINKBOX puts together is fantastic! The donuts are a must have & try to try them all. Some donuts even have some funky names like "Fat Elvis" & "pink snowball". 

Service was great. The girl behind the counter wasn't just friendly & helpful but she also threw in another glazed when she kinda squashed the one already in the box trying to close it. 

Besides "the strip", you guys are very fortunate to have PINKBOX donuts at your fingertips!

Recently my husband and I did go back.  The doughnuts were much better this go around.  Though I do wish that the fillings were not so centralized within the doughnut.  Some had a better dispersion so that each bite of the doughnut you could get all the flavors.  Thank you to for responding to my complaint.  Keep up the good work

This is my first time here.... There's one by my house on Durango, but heard that they close early and run out so I figured come to the original. I had the cookies and cream cake doughnut. Oreo topped doughnut with Oreo chunks throughout and a not too sweet icing in the hole (that's what she said). Super yum. Small store so we had to sit outside.

OMFG!!!!!

Kinda glad I don't live anywhere near this place! I'd be as big as a house. THe donuts are AMAZING!!!!! The Elvis and the Banana Cream Pie are every bit as delicious as they are beautiful. Just wish the one with the dates and blu cheese had more of a blu cheese punch. 

While the donuts are amazing, give their coffee a try! The chocolate macadamia coffee has developed into a new addiction!

Why do you place an order for 3 a.m. Only to get there and the service help at the counter knows nothing about. Then have to wait an additional 22 minutes when I am only person in the place. My glazed cronuts were over cooked. Not going to waste my time again. This is at the HENDERSON location.

Sadly went to pink box and there was not a lot of choices but the employees were way nicer this time. Not to mention the fact that they seemed high because they were laughing at everything we said , but I rather have nice employees than mean ones.

Went in for donuts and I was so surprised at how delicious these donuts were!
The staff was so helpful & friendly and coffee delicious too! The jelly donuts were filled-filled -filled with a nice amount of real razz-berry filling  - not some fake jell like custard & finally no cheaping out on the amount of filling. The donut holes which they do not call donut holes (sorry I cannot remember what there called) were so so tasty and large ! The donuts were fresh and it was 7:00 on a Sunday night.
The store needs some sprucing up ,not very appealing when you walk in,but the staff was so nice and donuts so good I over looked it.
My first time here and loved my banana cream pie donut. The girl that works there was super nice and very patient while I liked thru their selections

The first time I ever came to Pink Box after hearing and seeing it all over social media I was disappointed. I thought the gourmet donuts just weren't all that and it was all just hype. 

I was in the area again after dinner one night and decided to give them one last try and dang! So glad I did!  They were so much better this time! My favorites include banana creme pie, the old fashioned with sprinkles, coconut one, cereal bar, maple bacon. I could eat them all!    I've been returning once a week now to pick up a half dozen (unfortunate for my figure) but great for my tastebuds. 

Depending on what time it is, the freshness will vary. I've been at many multiple different times and days and it really just depends but I would assume every morning they would be at their peak freshness. 

Until someone starts an out of this world donut shop this one will stay my favorite!
We had a donut bar at our wedding and Pink Box made it awesome! The donuts were fresh and looked great! Thank you for helping make our day special
Just unbelievable flavors, iced today's chipotle carmel doughnut, the classic bacon  maple, and a repeat favorite cronut.  People at this shop make it personal making it even greater and comfortable.

What better way can a girl who is always on a diet spend her carbs then on a donut and/or cronut? If donuts are considered a dessert, then hands down, my favorite dessert ever is a good ol' donut! EVEN better is the cronut. Now, I never waste calories and I am known to spit stuff out if it falls short on taste...

We got the Fat Elvis, Regular Cronut, and a Chocolate donut. The Fat Elvis was just as the name describes it, fatty! Peanut butter and banana filling with a touch of honey. It's a favorite there but it wasn't mine. The boyfriend thought the mix was noncommittal - it should have more peanut butter or more banana and the mix just made it uninteresting and bland. It wasn't my favorite, but it also wasn't spit-worthy.

The cronut on the other hand... LOVED the texture! I love the taste of a plain glazed donut, so the taste of the regular cronut was delectably donutty with the buttery flakiness of a croissant. It was DELICIOUS. The chocolate donut was simple yet nicely represented the quality of the actual donut dough - it was soft, fluffy and moist. A good judge of donut quality are the basic ones like this plain chocolate, as it's taste isn't amplified or confusing by fillings and unique toppings; just dough and a glaze.

If you were to only pick one, I'd definitely get a regular cronut! Yum yum!

First time at this spot and OMG! As soon as you walk through the door, that heavenly aroma attacks your nose. I bought some cronuts and doughnuts for my husband and mom. They loved it! Very courteous staff and the location is only about 10 minutes from us. Will return and definitely recommend anyone to go give this sweet treat spot a try.

Good donuts, even the attempt at the maple bacon bar (VD PDX) thx to my wife and kids Pink box gets at least $60 a month from me... the only reason I give 4 stars is because the staff isn't friendly. It's not that they are unfriendly, it's just that I don't feel welcome when I walk in.  I'd prob be the same way if I had to sell donuts all day.

This place has the best donuts in town!!!! I love that they are open 24 hours on the weekends. The sweet potato donut is amazing! Try the peanut butter and jelly donut! The pumpkin chiffon donut was the best donut ever!
I only had the glazed cronut and I am a fan! I'll be making a stop at a Pink Box the next time I see one. :)

Cutesy shop, simple name. Everybody knows the symbolism of a pink box. Atop a kitchen counter, dining table, or in an office, automatically donut fans would expect there to be donuts.

I liked that when I walked in, the store did not have the aroma of donut grease.  You know what I mean though?  That Rainbow Donuts place I used to go to in Riverside had that donut grease smell.  No... it won't make a good scratch and sniff sticker or a gag scented candle.

I like that when approaching the doors, a musician in his musical zone was feeling his music, while jammin on his electric guitar.  I asked the donut connoisseur if that was okay by them.  He said they like his music.  I completely agree!  The musician sells CDs too.  Thought about it, and it would be cool to sit out there and listen to his tunes while being a donut face.

I love that Pinkbox has funky fun flavors like Bavarian creme filled, mocha creme, chocolate creme filled, chocolate rice crispies, cinnamon, and red velvet.  All perfect with a mug of caffeine!  Cuz donuts are sugarful, straight black coffee for me - to balance the rich sweetness with a bitter unblue-ness.  NICE!

Nothing like a fresh donut at 3am to alleviate a stressful night at work ! So few choices at 3am to satisfy cravings on the way home from work. Love this place and I can always depend on them to be consistently fresh. Great service too !!

I stopped in to get a dozen donuts on National Donut Day last Friday.  Service was super quick and efficient.  The staff was smiling and cheerful even though I'm sure any had worked all night to fill the donut orders for this awesome day! 

Donuts were so fantastic!  If you haven't been to Pink Box donuts, it's a must GO!  Yummy carbs!!

I don't think this place needs anymore reviews since everyone knows how awesome it is! Just beware sometimes they run out of donuts so don't get hyped out over a particular donut. Good news is there's sooo much good scrumptious donuts that they make up for it.
Pink Box is no joke, 1 of the best doughnuts I've ever had.  Love the Cinnamon Tornado and Apple Fritters.

A OK
Maybe I expected more? Maybe because the cronut fad is over? I don't know. I was excited to try a cronut, I know, it's like sooooooo 2014. Anyway, I got the.......cronut, and it was good. But I don't get the hype. I wouldn't rush back here to try it or anything. Prices were good and the selection was decent. I guess, I'm still a dunkin donuts girl at heart (hate me all you want)

Pink Box has some of the best doughnuts I have ever tasted. A very good variety of flavors, sometimes it is hard to choose which one to try. The staff is very friendly and ard helpful when I need a recommendation, I have even gotten a free doughnut a few times.

I've been wanting to try this place out for awhile now. Little did I know, I finally got a chance to give them a try when 4 dozen of these were brought to the office one morning. And honestly....this was NOT worth the hype. I've tried the "pink velvet" and a heart shaped periwinkle frosting custard-filled donut. A few of my co workers had the coco puffs, raspberry filled, pink sprinkles, fruity pebbles and Fat Elvis (she really enjoyed that one). What a waste of empty calories! =( It was wayyyyy tooo sweet and I felt like I would've been much more satisfied eating a Sprinkles Cupcake instead if I was going to stuff myself with sweet fatty empty calories. Just not worth it at all. My co worker said her coco puffs tasted stale. My "pink velvet" was super sweet!!!!!! Holy shit. O_O no thank you. And what's a pink velvet supposed to taste like? To me, it really just tasted like a regular donut. A co worker's fruity pebbles flakes were soggy too. (is it supposed to be a soggy consistency and not like an expected regular "cereal crunch feel?"

So to sum it up:
-not worth the hype
-way too sweet (sugar overload this early in the morning. I got a headache as I type this)
-it looks better than what it actually tastes
-some are better than others so choose wisely. Fat Elvis: good. Pink Velvet: bad.

My 3 star rating isn't because I don't like the place but just my personal opinion based on my taste buds. I know everyone's sweet tooth is different. If donuts are your type of thing, definitely give it a try and by all means...enjoy!

Worse part about this place? Choosing what to get! So many choices, so little stomach. Luckily, I came with a mission: cronuts!

I came for 1 and left with a dozen. I have  family that likes to eat, so I figured it wouldn't go to waste. I tried the fat elvis, nutty pig, cherry fritter, pumpkin, and of course the cronut. Don't worry, I didn't eat it all by myself, I just tried a piece of them. The fat elvis had peanut butter inside, it came in second place for my favorites. The cherry fritter had a nice tangy taste, not as sweet as apple fritters.

Let me tell you about this cronut though. A croissant/doughnut mixture? When you first look at it compared to the other beautiful doughnuts, it makes you think, "why did I come all the way here for this?" BUT when you take that first bite, it's definitely worth the visit. It seems unreal. They bake this fresh at 9 am! If you can come when they come out of the oven, I think you'll see your life change in front of your eyes. It was savory and fluffy on the inside and sweetly glazed on the outside. I would honestly drive across town to this cute little shop just for a couple of these delicious little doughnuts.

Awesome donuts!!!!!   Flavor and quality is second to none.  Sweet potato is awesome.  Apple pie fritter is best I have ever had, and for a true sin the cronut!!!!   Get em at 9am everyday.  They are so freaking good!!!

Cronut. Get the cronut. It's the lovechild of the croissant and doughnut. You would have to wait in line for hours in New York to get one, and here you can just waltz right in. 

Whenever I have guests in town I'll be sure to pick them up some cronuts from Pink Box. 

Edit - if you go too early the cronuts won't be ready. The optimal time to get them is about 10am.
Love the donuts. It's like cake. It's not so sweet. Just not a big fan for the cereal toppings and the red velvet cake. The cereals soak in the icing and become soggy.

SO it has been a year and a half since my first review and boy has this place changed. They are now open 24/7 and the selection has griwn 10 fold. Plus if you call and ask them for something if they don't have it, they will make it for you. Donuts are always fresh and the service is great. Well done Pink Box, love what you did to the place.  Only reason for the lack of a fifth star is kinda small and no place to sit inside with friends and family.

My husband and I are big donut people, so when we were together in Vegas we made a special trip to Pink Box. The selection is great, and the staff is friendly and helpful in picking out what you want. We got there around 5PM on Monday and there was no line, so we were able to take our time. I like the setup of the store: all of the donuts are in the window, and you select which one you want and they have giant stacks of trays and snatch a fresh donut for you. The donuts were unique, yeasted, a little dense, and chewy. there was just the right amount of frosting on each, and the Fritter was my absolute favorite! If you love donuts, you have to make a trip there. And next time I'm in Vegas, I will for sure be going back!

Stopped here the day before my birthday to get my coworkers a treat. The doughnuts were fresh, the service was fast, and the prices were ok. Not cheap, but definitely ok. Where this place shines is in the creativity. The only one I remember in particular was the Fat Elvis, and that alone will keep me coming back for more. All of my coworkers were desperate to know where I got the doughnuts. If you're on this side of town, it's a must try.

Edit: Now open 24 hours.

FAT ELVIS is AWESOME!!!! Also liked the cocopebbles YUM!! I read a couple reviews with complaints about them not having regular donuts. omfg they had 40 different kinds of donuts the day i went. NO WAY there isn't at least one you  would like. The ones i had were GREAT. So glad I tried this place. Here comes the calories. lol
Just grabbed some more donuts at 5:40 AM. They weren't even opened and they still let me in. Boyfriend was happy!

The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because the donuts are Ahhhhmazing!! However, the cashier in there was very rude!! It was both mine & my sons 1st time in there (we had no idea what they had but heard about how yummy they were) I even apologized & told her we had never been there but, she seemed like she could care less...her customer service skills need A LOT of work!! We will NOT be back because we found a better donut shop where we are treated like the place actually wants our money & the customer service is AWESOME!! its called Donut Mania on Durango & Peace Way!!!

This is a cool place to explore your creative side! I personally like the cronut (croissant-donut)  the best. What's even better is that its open 24 hours! My friend that I stay with lives about 30 seconds from here so that makes it even better.

This place has a lot of reviews already so I'll keep it short. BEST DONUTS IN VEGAS and I swear I'm not even a donut person! The dough is soft and chewy and the toppings/fillings are all super fresh and flavorful!! These are donuts that you only dream about lol! My favorite is the maple bacon omg and I've always  been the person that's like "uhh bacon on dessert?...idk..." but I'm hooked. Savory and sweet at the same time...my record has been eating three of these babies in 15 minutes. I'm very ashamed to admit this but that's how good they are. Even my mom, who is an old school asian lady who believes in fruit for dessert requested these for her birthday lol. My brother's favorite is the elvis and my mom's favorite is the pink snowball. I also really love the sweet potato, bavarian cream, banana cream, blueberry, cheesecake filled and whatever else is available lol. You honestly can't go wrong with any of these doughnuts!
The only thing I honestly HATE about this place is the way they pack them!!! Seriously! It looks like they just throw them in a box! There's a reason why every other donut place packs them in the same rectangular  box and not on top of each other. And it messes up all toppings and look of the donuts. All that hard work to beautify these donuts only to be tossed in a box. Tsk tsk.

Absolutely loved this place!!! I wanted to surprise my boyfriend and his friends with doughnuts for breakfast while in Vegas this weekend and I made the best choice by ordering from Pink Box Doughnuts. 

I spoke with Roberto and he was so accommodating with my crazy order. Everyone loved the doughnuts and I will be ordering from here again and telling everyone about them. 

Thank you so much for all of the yumminess!!!
Hands down the most original donut shop I've seen yet. The choices are staggering. I've gotta try me all.

Best doughnuts in town period. I personally like the cereal line...they have a fruity pebble topped doughnut and one with captin crunch cereal.  And the apple fritters are bigger than my face and so delish. On the weekends they are open 24 hours. Best part is a dozen doesn't break the bank.

I'm not much of a donut person but this place is pretty much donut lover heaven! & it's cheap! $9 for a dozen speciality donuts! UHHHHH yes!! 

I've been here a few times and each time they have new creative donuts. Of course they have the usual glazed and sugared donuts, but what they're known for is the extreme, out of the ordinary donuts. Like.. maple bacon, peanut butter cheesecake, sweet potato, key lime pie, double fudge, fruit loop, etc. There are so many that I can't even remember them all! Of course I couldn't try them all. My favorite is the sweet potato donut. I'm a simple gal.

Usually the donuts are pretty fresh. Every time I come there they are pulling out freshly baked donuts out of the oven. 

And best part about this place. They are OPEN 24 HOURS!! So for all you late night donut cravers, your prayers have been answered.

The main thing I want to emphasize about this location is the extremely superb customer service. I have been here countless times and every single time the women behind the counter were kind, cheery, accommodating, and a pleasure. Even at 2am. To be honest the donuts could taste like crap and I'd probably still come here because of the customer service. Now about the donuts - my favorite are the glazed cake and cronut holes. Cronut holes are perfect. For those who want a little something to cure the craving but that's not too sweet.

I've waited to write my review until I had been to Pink Box several times.  I can honestly say the quality of their doughnuts have been consistent from visit to visit.

Pink Box reminds me of Voodoo Doughnuts in Portland, minus the graphic references and not as much creativity in their flavor combos.  It is local to Las Vegas with multiple locations across the valley.

Don't look for garden variety doughnuts here, although they do have a devil's food glazed that ROCKS. They have their regular options, like the Fat Elvis (it has a caramelized banana slice on top), but also have a special creation that changes from month to month.  It entices you to come in every month...cuz when the flavor is gone, it's gone!

Definitely not your standard doughnut spot.  Worth a stop in, especially if you are new to Vegas!  Plus, it's always better in a pink box!  (Well, maybe a Tiffany blue box might be better!!

Love this place!!! Open 24 hours!  Donuts are always fresh!  Love the different varieties and price is well worth the taste!  Definitely have been there at least once a week for getting a dozen for our Family or Friends!  The chocolate cream and the Bavarian cream donut is very tasty!  Also, have special donuts which are s little more expensive but well worth it!
Been here multiple times and it never disappoints! A great place with good selection including my favorite "Campfire S'mores" doughnut.

I only had a taste of one of the Pink Box cronuts and it was OK.  I guess my taste buds were soured by the poor service I got when I went to pick up the order that was put in by a friend the day before.  I arrived in the time they had said--between 9 and 9:30.

First, they couldn't find the order, then they found it but asked me what she had ordered.  When I told them cronuts, the counter critter said, "We don't have cronuts.  What did she order?"  When I told them 6 cinnamon sugar and 6 glazed, they just got a box and put regualr doughnuts in the box.  They then tossed the order slip (I wish I had been able to see it) into the trash.  The friend later called and went back and got what she ordered but they couldn't find the slip.  Small wonder.

The cronuts from Pink Box are smaller in height than the others we had at our tasting.  I was told that they were much closer to the original cronuts introduced in NYC.  The cinnamon sugar cronut was OK but was greasy compared to the others we tasted.

The staff seemed to be in a fog.  Mr. Pink Box was there in his outfit to greet me and bid me adieu, but the business needs someone with organizational skills and smarts at the counter.  You can have the best doughnuts going, but if you give me the wrong stuff, it's a fail in my book!

IDK why, I have tried this place so many times, and I still do not like it
The dough texture is not good
And whatever oil they use leaves a  yucky flavor in my mouth
The elvis was just plain gross
S'mores tasted like cardboard
Cookies and cream was way too sweet
I get it donuts are not healthy, they are a fatty snack
But it should not be sooooo oily and sweet that it is repulsive

My boyfriend showed me this place yesterday and I was immediately attracted to the Pink Box! I bought a dozen for my boyfriends mom and she LOVED them! Donuts are delish!! Wish there was one in Henderson/Green Valley area!! I'm definitely coming back soon!!

Dont believe the hype...

So a classmate of mine, who is a Vegas native, put me on to pink box months ago. My classmate swore by pink box. So tonight as the hubby said "I want doughnuts" I told him about this place and hyped it up we drove across town and thats all she wrote...

WHAT A WASTE OF GAS... the doughnuts are overly sweet and honestly my thoughts were 7/11 produces the same quality doughnuts... The frosting, shortening and glaze are full of sugar and no flavor. You can taste the lack of money and quality that goes into the doughnuts.

I paid 14 for a dozen to try every flavor so I couldn't limit my review and I must say I wish I would've saved my money went to my local doughnut shop and got a dozen for half the price.

All in all thumbs down...

Save your money hit up Winchell if you want mediocre doughnuts for a reasonable price.

The doughnuts were definitely creative. The taste was average, just your typical doughnut I feel you could get anywhere. The service was really good, but because we came later in the day, most of the doughnuts were old or not available anymore.

3.5 stars rounded up because while I'm not really a doughnut fan, those who are absolutely rave when I pick up a box; service is always with a smile, and they are open 24/7. 

Never one to seek out a doughnut when looking for sweets, the ones I've tried and liked are: Maple Cronut, Sweet Potato, Date With a Nutty Pig, Key Lime and Green Tea. The doughnuts themselves are generally not too sweet, which I like, but the toppings trend far too sweet and are sometimes artificial tasting for my preferences. That said, they have been eagerly devoured by everyone when I've brought a box or two along, so, to each his or her own. 

Recently, I've stopped in several times to grab a few dozen for staff at MountainView Hospital: just seeing the box they got excited and gobbled them all up. So, I'd say that you are pretty safe to make most people quite happy if you arrive bearing these sweet treats!

* online ordering available *

** they deliver **
Been back since my last review when they first opened. Much better! Love the service and donuts!
cronuts and doughnuts are bajed fresh daily. they are open 24/7 and very friendly staff. always accommodating. their prices are great and wide variety of doughnuts

I love this place!! Really in love with the pink velvet donuts as well as the vanillanut coffee!! I could eat here everyday. Everyone is always friendly and you can get in an get out. I've never waited too long. I also got to try  A cronut, a crossiant texture but a donut taste. It was flaky and sweet and mmmm lol I'll always be back . At the lakemead location they are 24 hours,which is really nice. You can also call I orders

My friends and I had already been eating and facebooking photo's of the delish that comes from the Pink Box! Always fresh! Always greatness in a box! The other day I had the pleasure of meeting one of the owners while trying to get donuts ordered for my job. Unfortunately the original plans didn't work out because of my schedule but Lance did above and beyond to win me with is excellence customer service. So in return I will be a not only a customer, but a word of mouth advertising agent and supporter of the expansion of this business. 
***The taste of GREAT customer service will continue when the taste of the donuts have left your pallet!**
Love this place. Excellent service, delicious donuts, and amazingly friendly atmosphere.

The very first time I came to this place I thought it seemed a little overpriced and hyped but have since changed my mind and come here just about every week. The first experience wasn't that great because I had a Apple Fritter that wasn't good. I have since never ordered one of those and tried some of their other options. If you have never tried the Fat Elvis and love peanut butter, you should try it. The Fat Elvis is my favorite by far. The doughnuts here are a good size and range in price from $1 - $1.75 each. I haven't tried one of their Cronuts yet but you can call ahead and they will have have some ready for you if you can't be there at 9:30 am when they first come out for the day. Don't try and ask for one at 8 pm like I did. The guy behind the counter will laugh at you and say "No, we sold out for the day". These must be some damn good cronuts. As long as they aren't coated in overly sweet icing like that nasty "Coco's Donuts" then I am down to order some and check them out. The guy behind the counter was nice and let me know they were open 24 hours on weekends. If you stop by just after they open at 6 am you will smell the aroma of doughnuts as you walk towards the door.

Got in on a sat about 10 ish and place was jamming they need a bigger store front. ordered about a dozen for 13.00 mix and match for that price its still a great deal for quality stuff. The fat elvis was interesting, the bacon ones where goood. They said they sell out bye noon or so. This place is has lots of staff witch was interesting. will be back when I need a guilt trip esp since vegas drive connects up there, if your coming that way its not in the shopping center with the golds gym however if you drive towards lake mead its in front of the shopping complex.
I tried the gourmet apple fritter and it was fresh, fluffy, and sweet. But not too sweet. I still think Voodoo and Krispy Kreme are better though
OMG the Raspberry Filled Sugar Donut Is to die for!!!  So delicious!!!  The Boston Cream is my second favorite!  Love them gotta try them they go fast!
Nice place to get donuts anytime of the day or night I tend to go there late at night always friendly staff great selection anytime

This is an absolutely fabulous doughnut shop.  They make amazingly delicious doughnuts in flavors you would have never thought of.  Chocolate with cocoa  puffs.
Or how about a maple bar with BACON. Yes I said it BACON.  How unique is that??? The service is just as great, friendly, fast, fresh!!!! I highly recommend it.

First visit on an early Saturday morning, the donuts were "old".  Waited several months and paid a second visit, about mid-morning and again on Saturday, the donuts were "old".  I doubt we will visit for a third time.
Walked in at 2 am and the staff were extremely polite and courteous. Great to recieve great service even at this time of day! Also, you can't go wrong with $8.50 for  a dozen... Money well spent.

Very cute concept, name etc.. We had a cocoa krispie covered chocolate donut. Who knew cocoa krispie's are what donuts have been missing?! 

It was very good to say the least. Unfortunately when we went it was later in the day, so there were none of those nutty pig or fat elvis donuts around. Will be back for a box when out of town guests need a quick breakfast.

Just okay.  The name Pink Box makes me think it's something fancier.  What I was expecting.
In actuality, the donuts are boxed in a generic pink box. The shop is small.  The arrangement of the display case could be better if seen when entering the store instead of stuck off to the side where only one or two people can view the goodies. While the creations are pretty, they're just okay. They didn't seem fresh to me.
Outstanding!! Great service & attention to detail. This quaint little donut shop epitomizes the American Dream

Ate here recently and liked it.  I think for the most part you can ignore the Negative Nellies on here...at least some of these donuts are top notch and deserve praise.  The apple fritter specifically - I like it better than any I've had in the area (previous champ = Winchells).  I also liked the boston creme and cake-like donuts.  And, the price is decent, $12.50 for a dozen of basically any 12.  

Now there is some bad news and this is more subjective than anything.  The peanut butter/banana one did not do it for me.  I thought it might but it did not.  Also the smores doughnut was good but it (for me anyway) could have used some "stuffing" inside.  Maybe some hersheys or marshmellow creme would have made it even better.  

I got there at like 8am, had my run of the place.  I don't think it's that odd at all to get to a doughnut shop at 10am and find they are out of everything good.  If anything that's typical (except for maybe Krispy Kreme) and I buy doughnuts all over town several times a month.

If you like apple fritters please try this place.  If you like doughnuts in general also consider popping in.  I mean a half dozen is what $5 or so - shouldn't break the bank and you probably will be pleasantly surprised.

I so hate you now, Pink Box Doughnuts!
I bought a dozen for my work and as I was standing there, I felt a disturbance in the Force.....my eyes fell on a small, circular tower of dough that you so-helpful clerk stated was a "cronut."
I thought, "that is a silly name for a doughnut," and figured I'd try it.
So sorry Kristy Kreme, I now have a new favorite pastry!
Light and flaky like croissant, but glazed and delicious like a doughnut, and now you are open 24 hours!!!!! 
Damn you Pink Box!  (See you tomorrow night!)

i want to say something about the gentleman working. it's mother's day and lit af in there, he helped me out with a special order when he really didn't have to for how hectic is was. i don't go to pinkbox often, all locations are far from wear i live. when i do go i kind of do have an expectation. haven't been disappointed

I love the Cheesecake doughnut! Definitely a great dessert, as there are so many great places to eat over here!!

The owner, one of the brothers, is super nice and customer service oriented!!

Oh my goodness! The maple bars are so fluffy and heavenly. I actually got a dozen of those to share with family and friends because they were so good! 

Every time I go, I have great, fast service. Everyone there is so friendly. I recommend this place to anyone seeking donuts! Yummy!!!

THINK OUTSIDE THE PINK BOX!  

Which is exactly what these guys have done.  Pink Box is not your average donut shop.  What's unique about it you ask?  Pink Box is going for the WOW factor...something different....something to get people talkin.  Which if you haven't heard the buzz by now then you don't get out much. 

We all know the new "dessert with bacon" craze and the extreme cooking shows that like to shock you with unique and crazy ingredient combinations that you wouldn't see everyday.  This is right down the same line of cooking craziness.  Speaking of cooking shows, did you know that Pink Box was featured in "Roadtrip with G. Garvin" on the Cooking Channel?  I think it was a small kick-start to the madness.  Quite impressive I must say....you should check it out. ;)

So I was asked to bring a dessert to a get-together.  I'm always the overachiever that wants to figure something thats new to everyone with a goodness to leave a "mad at it" (but in a good way) impression on everyone.  As I think about what I want to do I remember a few recent Yelp reviews that I had read recently.  How could it be any perfect on the overachievement level???

First off I decide to check them out online.  They have an "order online" option.  Perfect because I was at work and it was totally convenient and fast.  I put all my info in and it thanked me for my order.  I stated that I will be picking up around 1pm while I was on my lunch.  IF ONLY this system worked....read on...

When I walk up you could smell a delicious sweetness in the air.  There was a sign blowing in the wind above the door stating that its now opened 24 hours on the weekend.  I guess there is a need?  For your drunken satisfaction?  I'm gonna have to do a drive by in the middle of the night.  There might be a party going on at 2am that we don't know about!  When I walk in there are 3 people already in line.  The place is not that big so it filled up pretty quick.  There were employees in the back talking and laughing.  I kept hoping that one of them would come up and help the poor guy trying to assist everyone considering I was on my lunch and drove way out of my way to get there.  Finally after the few people funneled out it was my turn.  Mind you at this point there was already a line behind me.   I let him know I ordered ahead online.  He sifted through all these papers and mentioned that his boss didn't give him any order for me.  Party FAIL...so much for convenience!  SO starting from scratch I made my random selections.  I also ordered two extra to bring to my boss hoping he might let me off early. hehe...no such luck.

The guy was super nice and helpful.  He rang me up for a dozen and gave me the two extras for free for the trouble of not having my order.  The total was something like $8.50.  I had thought on the website it would be $12 something.  Oh well I wasn't going to ask.  So I get my pink box of heaven in the car and notice the grease or icing or something seeping through the box.  I opened the box and the donuts were all over the place just thrown in the box.  I counted 11 donuts.  Hm  I could have sworn a dozen means 12.  Scratching my head. Oh well whatever as I roll my eyes.  This only happens to me.  I. swear.

Now I went for a variety of everything with intention that we would cut them up eventually so everyone could try a bite of each.  The maple bacon and the nutty pig were among the favorites by far.  They have all kinds of regular donuts along with their specialty kinds putting a little love in each one.  The nutty pig has bacon and blue cheese on it.  There was barely any blue cheese but those who ate it loved it.  Some of the doughnuts are topped with cereal...captain crunch, fruity pebbles etc.  Kids would be in heaven.

Anyways, overall and not really being a sweets person I wasn't overly impressed.  I do love the concept and I will for sure return for 1 or another dozen (TWELVE) to take to a get together. Personally I can just stick to the regular glaze doughnut with rainbow sprinkles.  I do recommend them to put wax paper underneath so they don't soak through the box....or they may have to change their name to Soggy Box Doughnuts!   Werrrrd.  =P
